section.title: Overview
section.para: In a Documentary Credit transaction, the exporter is required to gather and prepare the documents conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit, and then present them to the bank.

The eUCP supplement to the UCP500 rules allows the electronic presentation of the documents, thus offering new opportunities for the exporter to speed up, enhance and automate this document preparation and presentation process.

The (DM) module enables the exporter to prepare and manage online a set of documents required in a trade transaction. It handles both the document attachment and the online document generation for some key documents such as the Commercial Invoice, Bill of Exchange or Packing List:

listitem.para: The exporter can therefore gather the electronic documents he's already generated in external systems, or received from the insurance company, freight forwarder or other thirds party involved in the goods processing.

For a useful set of standard documents he can also online key-in the document details in dedicated input forms, and then generate the document: PDF or XML output formats are proposed, and customized additional ones could be added.

section.para: The document presentation to the bank is also implemented as an additional functionality of this module, allowing the exporter to select the documents he wishes to present and issue the presentation.

The electronic documents gathered or externally prepared are supposed to be signed by the issuer before being uploaded. And the module provides an enhanced signature mechanism allowing the user to sign the PDF documents he's generated online. The module therefore provides a perfect integrated solution for the eUCP compliant presentations.
The actions that the exporter can undertake in this module are the following:

listitem.para: The documents are grouped and managed in document folders, that match the real life trade files the users are used to manipulate. The exporter can create or amend delete folders. Within the folder, the user has the option to fill in the common transaction details in a generic template form. This template can be later used to generate new documents in the folder, the template data being defaulted in the document input form. This functionality definitely speeds up the keying process: indeed most of the documents share the same transaction data (parties, product description or others) that is now keyed and defined once.

Within a document folder, the exporter can add or delete individual documents, manage the documents status, and eventually update and regenerate some documents. The new documents can be added different ways:

UPLOAD - New documents can be added to the folder by simply uploading the corresponding file. The user can therefore attach any documents he's received from third parties in an electronic format, or he's scanned or externally generated. Also note such documents can be signed.

GENERATE - The user can alternatively create or later-on update documents. The user selects the standard document type he wants to add or generate (the key standard documents are available, such as the Commercial Invoice, Bill of Exchange or Packing List). He is then proposed a document specific input form where he keys (or update) common transaction details related to the goods, charges, and shipment. For each generated document, various output formats are proposed and generated on-demand for these documents: PDF, XML, other customized output ... The user can choose to initiate the new document from the folder template data he may have prepared. The relevant data is then copied from the template and defaulted in the new document input form.

COPY - With this generation initialization option, the user chooses to generate a new document from an existing document in the folder or in another folders. The relevant data (data that can be shared between the 2 document types) is then copied and defaulted in the new document input form.
NEW VERSION - With this generation initialization option, the user chooses to issue a new version of a document he's already prepared, validated and versioned.

Once all the required documents are gathered and prepared, the exporter is most likely willing to present them to his bank. This feature allows him to select a document preparation folder and issue a presentation (partial or full) to its bank, selecting the documents he wants to be presented.

This action is displaying the list of all the records that are still in a pending state, which means whether folders on the client side initiated but not yet internally approved, or presentations issued to the bank but not yet acknowledged. The first category of records can be opened directly from this page to update their current content or state.

Through this action, the applicant is able to browse through all his existing document folders in order to electronically review their details or their history, and eventually print a hard copy of their data or regenerate or download some documents.

In order to clean up his workspace of outdated incomplete or purged transactions, the user can delete the folders or documents bearing an appropriate state. The user can also parameterize the documents output made available for the various document types.

section.title: Document Folder Options
section.para: This action is associated with several sub-menu items, each of them covering a particular option to perform the initiation of a new Document Folder.

section.title: New Folder
section.para: With the option New Folder, a new Document Folder is created from scratch, from a blank form.

section.title: New Copy
section.para: With this option New Copy, a new Document Folder is created, but the folder details are copied from an existing Document Folder.
The document template details are also copied, but not the documents that may exist in the source folder.

The initial list presented to the user is potentially displaying all existing Document Folder. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the assigned System Id for the Document Folder, on the customer Reference given to the folder, on the Consignee name or Currency strings. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all fields, and to return all existing records, the user could for instance set the reference to a star (*) and run the search.

The columns returned are the System Id, customer folder Reference, Consignee name, Currency, Amount and Creation Date of the Document Folders matching the search criteria, and the user can decide to sort the display to show each column in an ascending or descending order.
The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are opening a new Document Folder based on the details found in the selected source Document Folder.

section.title: New From EL
section.para: With the option New From EL, a new folder will be created based on the content of an Export Letter of Credit in the system. This data defaulting will definitely speed-up the data key-in, and automate the document preparation corresponding to this underlying credit. Most of the information of the Export Letter of Credit will be defaulted in the new folder document template, except key data such as the currency and amount of the new Document Folder.

When selecting this option, the user is presented with a list of all the existing Export Letter of Credit of his company. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the assigned System Id for the Export Letter of Credit, the Applicant Name, and the Currency of the Export Letter of Credit. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all fields.
The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are re-opening the Export Letter of Credit message in input mode.

The columns returned are the System Id , Bank Reference, Applicant Name, Currency, Amount, Issue Date and Expiry Date of the Export Letters of Credit matching the search criteria, and the user can decide to sort the display to show each column in an ascending or descending order. The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are opening a new Document Folder based on the details found in the selected Export Letter of Credit.

section.title: Existing Folder
section.para: The Existing Folder feature allows the user to open an existing Document Folder and amend the folder general details or the document template details.
The initial list presented to the user is potentially displaying all existing Document Folder.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: The option Retrieve Draft is displaying a list of all the Document Folder creation or amendment records which have already been prepared and saved by the input user, but whether not completed or simply not validated yet because of a lack of authorization in the profile of the potential submitter.

A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the assigned System Id for the Document Folder, the exporter Reference for the Document Folder, the name of the Consignee, the Currency and/or the User Name of the exporter input agent. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all fields.

The columns returned are the System Id, customer Reference, the Type of the draft transaction (New or Amend), the Consignee Name, Currency, Amount, User Name and Input Date of the Document Folder pending records matching the search criteria, and the user can decide to sort the display to show each column in an ascending or descending order.
The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are re-opening the Document Folder creation or amendment record in input mode.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: The option Retrieve Unsigned is returning a list of all the Document Management creation or amendment records which have been completed internally but not yet validated because of a lack of authorization in the input user's profile.

The list presented to the user is displaying all the Document Folder creation or amendment records pending for final validation. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the same criteria as for the Retrieve Draft option, and the same columns are returned.

The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are presenting the transaction details of the Document Folder creation or amendment record in a non-editable form, with the capability of reviewing the data and performing the actual validation.

section.title: Operations
section.para: The operations that can be performed from the Document Folder creation or amendment pages are listed below. For each of them, a confirmation popup window will ask the user to confirm his choice.

Note the document folder creation and amendment transaction submission process differs from the one proposed in the other modules since the Document Folders are not submitted to the bank for acknowledgment.

entry.para: Operation
Description

The transaction details entered will be saved as draft (or uncontrolled) which means that the Document Folder creation or amendment will remain as a pending record without being validated. No control on the mandatory fields is performed at this stage.
The user chooses this action when all the requested (and mandatory) details of the transaction have been entered and the resulting file is ready for control.

Depending on the jurisdiction profile of the user (and in particular the amount he is authorised to validate without an additional signature), the transaction record will whether remain as unsigned or be controlled. Note that the amount evaluated by the Jurisdiction module is the folder total amount.

section.title: Documents Options
section.para: The document creation, edition, deletion and versioning in an existing document folder will be performed through the Document menu item. It is composed of the options described below.

section.title: Edit
section.para: With the option Edit, the user selects an existing Document Folder and accesses the document edition form on. He can then:

listitem.para: View the documents already versioned,
View the documents under preparation,
Edit the documents under preparation,
Add new documents to the folder,
Delete from the folder some of the documents under preparations.

section.para: When he's selected the Edit option, the user is first presented with a list of potentially all the existing Document Folder records. A search can be performed on the items displayed by adjusting a search pattern on the assigned System Id for the folder, customer Reference , Consignee Name or Currency. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all fields, and they must be used to initially return some records. A wildcard in the System Id would return all the existing records.

The columns returned are the System Id, customer Reference, Consignee Name, Currency, Amount, Creation Date of the Document Folders matching the search criteria, and the user can decide to sort the display to show each column in an ascending or descending order. The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are opening the selected Document Folder in the Document edition form.

section.title: Version
section.para: With the option Version, the user selects an existing folder and accesses the documents versioning form, in order to validate and version some of the documents under preparation.

When a document is versioned it can't be altered any more: indeed it may have been already generated and printed, or presented to the bank. If required a new version of the document should instead be created, with the same document reference but an incremented document version number: this is done with the above Edit option. However a versioned document can be purged from the system in the Maintain section. Also note only versioned documents can be presented to the bank.
The list presented to the user is displaying all the pending Document Folder records having documents under preparation.

The search criteria and the columns returned are similar as in the above Edit option. The System Id column items are hyperlinks that are opening the Document Folder record in the Document versioning form.

section.title: Commercial Invoice Form
section.para: A Commercial Invoice is a document sent from the seller to the buyer that is generally a claim for payment under the terms of the contract between both parties. The Invoice is a statement showing the particulars of the goods or services sold, and includes details of quantity, price and charges. Typically the receipt of the Purchase Order and the subsequent dispatch of goods, or the delivery of services, trigger the Commercial Invoice.
The Commercial Invoice is also used by government agencies, such as Customs and Excise, to determine the true value of the goods for the calculation of the duty payable.
The presentation of the Commercial Invoice generally triggers the payment of the goods.
The commercial invoice input form shows the following sections:
These sections have already been described for the Folder Form (template details description).

section.title: Packing List Form
section.para: A Packing List is a document issued by the seller to other parties such as Carrier, Customs, Buyer, Consignee containing detailed information about the goods, package type, package count, product count and other characteristics such as weight.
The Packing List is used by the Carrier or Forwarding Agent to ascertain the total shipment weight and volume.

Typically the Packing List is produced following the receipt of a Purchase Order from the potential buyer and is most often included with the other original documents for dispatch to the buyer or through a bank according to the terms of settlement.
The packing list input form shows the following sections:
These sections have already been described for the Folder Form (template details description).

section.title: Certificate of Origin Form
section.para: The Certificate of Origin provides documentary evidence of the origin of the goods in transit.

The production of this document is a common requirement by countries wishing to identify the origin of all imported goods, for example, to ensure that quotas are not exceeded or import restrictions are not breached.

Where authentication is required, the Certificate of Origin Application is completed by the exporter and sent to an appropriate authority, for example the relevant Chamber of Commerce, that would then issue the Certificate. Where authentication is not required, this document should be completed by the exporter.
The certificate of origin input form shows the following sections:
These sections have already been described for the Folder Form (template details description).

section.title: Bill of Exchange Form
section.para: A Bill of Exchange is a draft by which the drawer makes an unconditional undertaking to pay to the drawee a sum of money at a given date, usually three months ahead.
In principle a bill of exchange is similar to a post-dated cheque, and like a cheque it can be endorsed for payment to the bearer or any named person other than the drawee.
A bill of exchange has to be accepted (endorsed) by the drawee before it becomes negotiable.
The bill of exchange input form shows the following sections:
These sections have already been described for the Folder Form (template details description).

section.title: Document Presentation Options
section.para: Once the user has prepared its document folder and gathered or prepared the documents, the Document Presentation function allows him to send part or all the documents to the bank: the documents to be presented are selected, and the record sent to the bank for acceptation. Multiple presentations can be issued on a document folder.

This module answers a strong requirement of the exporter by offering a eUCP-compliant way of document submission to the bank. Indeed the document externally generated or received from third parties can be signed and uploaded, and the Document Presentation offers an enhanced signature mechanism for all PDF documents generated. Also note in the case of eUCP presentations, the electronic documents may be sent by third parties to the bank: the exporter will issue a presentation without any document attached in order to signify the presentation completeness.
The options associated with this menu item are the same as when creating a Document Folder, and you may refer to this chapter if you need further details on the options summarised below.

section.title: Existing Folders
section.para: The list of all existing Document Folder is displayed to let the user select the one on which the presentation will be issued. The same search options and sort criteria are offered. Once a record has been selected, an input form is displayed to let the user enter the details of the presentation.

As for the other cases of initiation from an existing Document Folder, the user must at least enter some details in the search pattern before it is called. When the number of existing transaction rises, this is to ensure that the page does not take too much time to load.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: All the Document Presentations in progress will be shown, meaning the folders records on which such a presentation has already been prepared and saved but not yet submitted to the bank. After a selection in the list, the data will be presented in an input form to allow further modifications.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option presents the list of all presentations that the input user has released, and are pending for the controller approval and submission to the bank.

Indeed the presentation can't be directly submitted to the bank by the inputer, that only releases the presentation when all the requested (and mandatory) details of the presentation have been entered and the presentation is ready for signature before submission to the selected bank.

The controller can then open the presentation in non-editable Unsigned mode, where he's proposed to sign the documents generated as PDF (Portable document Format) before the final submission to the bank.
When such an unsigned presentation record is selected from the list, a non-editable form presenting its details is displayed.
The same search options and sort criteria as for the folder amendment are also available in the list.

section.title: Documents Signature
section.para: When the controller opens the presentation in non-editable Unsigned mode, he sees the list of document files the inputer have selected and generated.

He can then to sign the documents generated as PDF (Portable document Format) before the final submission to the bank. An enhanced signature mechanism is indeed proposed for all the PDF documents online prepared and generated in the module.

The Sign icon
in front of each of these PDF documents triggers the document opening in Adobe Acrobat, where the user can sign the document and submit it back to .

This signature process requires the user to have the full Adobe Acrobat installed on its computer: indeed only this full version implement the signature functionality. The plugin must also be installed and loaded in Adobe Acrobat in order to have access to the submission button that send back the signed file.
These requirements and installation setup are detailed in a specific document.

section.title: Operations
section.para: The operations that can be performed from the Document Presentation page are listed below. For each of them, a confirmation popup window will ask the user to confirm his choice.
Note the presentation transaction differs from the other document folder creation and amendment transactions since the presentation is submitted to the bank for acknowledgment.

Note also the bank submission process differs from the one proposed in the other modules since the presentation can't be directly submitted to the bank by the inputer. Indeed the inputer only releases the presentation when all the requested (and mandatory) details of the presentation have been entered and the presentation is ready for signature before submission to the selected bank. The controller can then open the presentation in non-editable Unsigned mode, where he's proposed to sign the documents generated as PDF (Portable document Format) before the final submission to the bank.

section.title: Pending Folders
section.para: In order to help the users review the list of Document Folder transaction records in a pending state, provides the Pending Folders menu item. This function would be used typically by a manager who wants to monitor at any time the consolidated list of folder transactions (initiations, amendments, presentations) prepared internally but not yet controlled, or I the case of a the document presentation transactions not yet sent to the bank or submitted but pending for an acknowledgement from the bank.

The goal of this function, beyond serving as a consolidated list, is to let the user quickly access the action required to interact with a given transaction record. Therefore, depending on the state of the record, the user will be able to directly open it in edit mode, or in review/signature mode (only if it has been submitted before but is still pending for additional credentials).
The list displayed is fetching the Document Folder transaction records of types:

listitem.para: New (for a creation in progress),
Amend (for an ongoing folder amendment),
Presentation (for a presentation),

section.para: and whose transaction statuses are:

listitem.para: Incomplete (related to the basic Save action and the Retrieve Draft menu item),

Uncontrolled (when the input user chose the Submit action but did not have sufficient privilege to control the creation or amendment, or to send the presentation to the bank, related to the Retrieve Unsigned menu item),
Submitted (when a presentation transaction record has reached the bank but has not yet been acknowledged by its Trade Services department).

section.para: Each record is presented with its generated folder System Id , customer Reference, Type, transaction Status, Consignee Name, Currency, Amount, and Input Date, and each of these columns can be sorted by ascending or descending order.
The search can be performed by adjusting a pattern on the assigned folder System Id, customer Reference, and Consignee Name or Currency fields. The usage of wildcards is allowed for all three fields.
An additional choice is also available in the form to let the user select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: The default option is set to Screen and it returns the list of matching records in the same page with the usual sorting features.

If the user wants to export the list as a report typically to use it or customize it further in his local office productivity tools, he can select the CSV option or the SpreadSheet option. This choice produces a file whose data is displayed as Comma-Separated Values or as a file directly understandable by an application such as Microsoft Excel. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, the client can decide to save the file (whose default name is pendingDM.xxx) or directly open it which would launch Excel if it is available on the client's workstation.

section.para: As mentioned above, each record will be eventually prefixed by one or two action icons depending on its status:

entry.para: Visual
Description
With the Edit icon, the current transaction record will be opened in edit mode in order to let the user change its details (same as selecting a record in any of the Retrieve Draft menu items).
Through this symbol, the user will open the transaction record in non-editable form (the same way and with the same capabilities as through a Retrieve Unsigned menu item).

This icon opens a popup window displaying the event details of the selected transaction record. It is available in front of the submitted records whose details have already been transmitted to the bank, as a convenience for the client to review what has been sent.

section.title: Inquiry
section.para: At any point in time, the client may want to inquire for his own list of ongoing Document Folders, in order to check their status or anything related to their details or history. The purpose of the Inquiry menu item is to serve such needs.

When initially reaching the page, the user is presented with a blank form listing the available search criteria. Compared to the lists that have been presented thus far, no default content is provided for this product inquiry since the list could be extremely long when the client has initiated many transactions, and the choice of some search patterns is therefore mandatory.

The inquiry can be adjusted according to the assigned folder System Id, the customer Reference, the Consignee Name or the transaction Currency. If the user wants to obtain the complete list of all existing Document Folders, a wildcard * can be entered in the System Id field before submitting the search.
As for the pending records in the previous chapter, an additional choice is available in the form to let the user select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: The default option is set to Screen and it returns the list of matching records in the same page with the usual sorting features.

If the user wants to export the list as a report typically to use it or customize it further in his local office productivity tools, he can select the CSV option to produce a Comma-Separated Values file, or the SpreadSheet option to produce an Excel compatible file. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, the client can decide to save the file (whose default name is inquiryDM.xxx) or directly open it which would launch Excel if it is available on the client's workstation.

section.para: Each record is displayed with its System Id, the customer Reference, the Consignee Name, the Currency and Amount, as well as the Issue Date and the product Status.
All columns can be sorted, and each record is prefixed with the following action icons to let the user further refine his inquiry:

entry.para: Visual
Description
This action will open a list of all versioned documents the user can immediately download or re-generate.
This action will open a popup window displaying the current master details of the transaction record.

The history action icon will open a list of all the events for the selected record, detailing the complete history of the file. For each event in the life of the file, the list is showing the Release Date (date on which the related event was sent to the bank, or the date it was by the bank if the latter is undefined as typically for a bank message), the Type of the event, the Status of acknowledgement as replied by the bank, the Currency and transaction Amount (e.g. the total amount for a Document Folder creation or amendment, or the presentation amount for a presentation), and the identities of the input and control users.

section.para: In the historical part of the Inquiry, each release date as defined above is also a hyperlink opening a popup window showing all the specific details of each event.

Within the information displayed, the Event Details section highlights only the key details specific to the selected event. It always contains the eventual additional instructions and attachment provided by the customer as well as for presentation records the bank's comment and attachments given as part of the reporting. Here are some examples covering various types of transactions:

listitem.para: In the case of a Document Folder creation or amendment, a summary of details of the brand new file, such as the system and reference numbers, the amount and dates will be shown. For such an issuance, the system also displays the full set of data submitted by the customer to initiate that file.
For a presentation, only the structured information related to the presentation itself will be shown.

section.para: When the Event Details header in the popup window shows a Release Date/Time, it refers to the timestamp of the release of the validated transaction event by the customer to the bank.
Together with the Bank Message header, the Date/Time field refers to the timestamp of the submission of the reporting message by the bank to the customer.

The client can also decide to export the history report as an external file bearing the CSV format. This is done by choosing it in the Output Format list box and clicking on the icon
. The name of the file downloaded is made of the System Id of the transaction together with a .csv extension. E.g. DM0110001008.csv for the Document Folder whose the system identifier is DM0110001008.

section.title: Folder Maintenance
section.para: This last function in the module is letting the user perform maintenance tasks on some of the Document Folder records handled by his company, in order to avoid the front-end to be polluted with outdated transaction records.

note.para: The records deleted through this feature will be physically removed from the system and this task should therefore be conducted with the uttermost attention!

section.para: The menu item is therefore split into two options to cover these requirements:

section.title: Unsigned Folders
section.para: The Unsigned Folders option is displaying a list of all the Document Folder transaction records (creation, amendments or presentations to bank) which have been prepared by the client but that have not been controlled or sent to the bank yet for various reasons.

Some of these records may appear to be outdated and these entries will never actually be validated and controlled, hence requiring a user on the client side with administrator's privilege to remove these pending records from the system.

The list can be adjusted with a search pattern on the folder System Id, the name of the Consignee or the Currency of the transaction, and wildcards can also be used. Each record is displayed with its System Id, the Consignee Name, its Type, its transaction Status (see above the Pending Folders option for an explanation of the transaction status), its Currency and transaction Amount as well as the related Input Date.

The last column is composed of a checkbox which the user should check in front of each record that are supposed to be deleted. When the choice has been made on one or several records, the Delete action at the bottom of the page can be submitted. After the acknowledgement of a confirmation message box, the updated list of transaction records is displayed to the user.

section.title: Purged Folders
section.para: This other option is dedicated to the existing Document Folders the user wishes to purge from the system.
The behavior of this list is similar to the option above where the user performs the deletion through the selection of the un-wanted records by marking their related checkbox.

section.title: Purged Documents
section.para: This other purge option is dedicated to the purge of versioned documents from within existing Document Folders.

Some documents may have been updated and new versions created, others may be outdated, hence requiring a user on the client side with administrator's privilege to remove these versioned documents from the system.
The user is proposed the list of the existing document folders. The behavior of this list is similar to the various existing Document Folder lists previously described.
When the user selects a Document Folder, he's presented the list of only the versioned documents in the folder, hence available for purge.

section.para: This other option is dedicated to the set-up of the transformations and output formats proposed for the documents generated.

Indeed for each document type that can be online prepared by the module (Commercial Invoice, Packing List, Bill of Exchange, Certificate of Origin), several output formats can be generated, among which a PDF (Portable document Format) and a XML representation. Other custom outputs can also be implemented, for instance with the user's company logo.
For each document the user is therefore proposed the various transformations that have been authorised in this parameter configuration screen.

note.para: The uploaded documents are not concerned by this parameter, and only the download option will be proposed for them.
